attributes.action: prevent the inclusion of privately owned horseboxes in low emission zone legislation
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Privately owned horseboxes are vehicles usually being used in a second lease of life. 
These vehicles are easily differentiated by their registration as "Private Light Goods" vehicles, and by not being subject to an "Operators licence".
These vehicles cover a low annual mileage and contribute little to the emissions in the proposed zone due to their low numbers.
It is unrealistic to convert these vehicles to a later specification for emission reduction, both on a technological and cost basis.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "prevent the inclusion of privately owned horseboxes in low emission zone legislation."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page12565.asp
